title: A Broken Ladder
headline: Contract Workers Climb a Broken Career Ladder
description: Landing a role at a tech company promises high wages, stability, innumerable benefits, and upward mobility—but many contract workers experience anything but. They are less likely to be paid as much as their directly-employed peers, have access to fewer benefits, less likely to get a raise or promotion, and are rarely hired for full-time roles.

quote.text: Back then people thought it was the dream to work there. And because of that, I kept telling myself that’s where I need to be to prove my worth to the world.
quote.author: Anonymous Contract Worker
